The percentage of mail: in ballots rejected in Miami-Dade County was less than 1% as of October 30th.
The most common reason for ballot reject: 3. Miami-Dade County contacts voters with rejected ballots to provide them with an opportunity to fix or "cure" their ballot if the signature is missing or doesn't match.
The claim of 23: of early ballots being rejected for missing signatures appears to be a misinterpretation or misinformation, potentially originating from an op-ed in the Tampa Bay Times.
